senses.de: A gathering of people for entertainment or celebration
senses.ex: She's hosting a birthday party at her house

Tips.title: Social Gathering
Tips.description: Often implies fun and celebration, usually among friends and family.
Tips.example: You're invited to our Halloween party next week!

Tips.title: Planning Required
Tips.description: Usually involves organization for food, music, and activities.
Tips.example: They spent weeks planning their wedding party.

Tips.title: Event Invitation
Tips.description: An event where guests are usually invited with a notice in advance.
Tips.example: Did you get an invite to her birthday party?

senses.de: One of the groups involved in a legal matter, dispute or deal
senses.ex: The parties agreed to settle out of court

Tips.title: Legal Context
Tips.description: Refers strictly to participants in legal matters, not social events.
Tips.example: The party of the first part shall pay all fees within 30 days.

Tips.title: Legal Relationship
Tips.description: Indicates a relationship between entities under legal discussion.
Tips.example: All parties to the agreement must sign the document.

Tips.title: May Involve Conflict
Tips.description: In disputes, parties often have opposing views.
Tips.example: The parties couldn't reach an agreement and went to trial.

senses.de: A political group with common ideals or practices
senses.ex: He's a member of the Democratic Party

Tips.title: Shared Ideals
Tips.description: Political parties unite people with similar political goals and views.
Tips.example: She voted for the Green Party because of their environmental policies.

Tips.title: Election Participation
Tips.description: Political parties often run candidates in elections to gain power.
Tips.example: The party is campaigning hard for the upcoming elections.

Tips.title: Governance Role
Tips.description: A ruling party sets and implements government policies.
Tips.example: The current ruling party is focusing on economic reforms.

senses.de: To enjoy oneself at a social gathering or event
senses.ex: We partied all night after the concert

Tips.title: Enjoyment Focus
Tips.description: Emphasizes having fun and often includes dancing, music, or games.
Tips.example: They partied until sunrise after the graduation.

Tips.title: Casual Event
Tips.description: Usually less formal and happens in relaxed settings like clubs or homes.
Tips.example: We decided to party at my place after the movie.

Tips.title: Late Hours Common
Tips.description: Partying often occurs at night and can last until morning.
Tips.example: After the show, everyone was ready to party all night.

senses.de: A group of people assembled for a particular activity or journey
senses.ex: A search party was dispatched to find the missing hiker

Tips.title: Specific Purpose
Tips.description: A group formed with a specific objective in mind, like a rescue or trip.
Tips.example: The tour guide led our party through the ancient ruins.

Tips.title: Temporary Formation
Tips.description: This type of party is often created for a single event or short-term goal.
Tips.example: A party of volunteers was organized to clean the park.

Tips.title: Group Unity
Tips.description: Members share a common task and are usually cooperative with each other.
Tips.example: The fishing party worked together to navigate the rough waters.

Bash.wordDefinition:
Both bash and party refer to a social gathering, but there are subtle differences in connotation and usage.

Bash typically implies a larger, more raucous gathering with a celebratory atmosphere - it may involve loud music, alcohol, and a lot of people.

If you're planning a louder, more energetic gathering, you might use the word bash. If you're planning a more casual, laid-back social event, party may be more appropriate.

Celebrate.wordDefinition:
Celebrate refers to acknowledging and commemorating a special occasion or event in a joyful manner, often with expressions of gratitude or appreciation.

Party refers to a social gathering or event where people come together to celebrate, often with food, drinks and entertainment.

Celebrate is more focused on the significance of the event, while party emphasizes the social aspect of the gathering.

Celebrate can be applicable in any situation that calls for acknowledging or honoring an occasion, while party can be applicable when people want to come together and enjoy themselves.

Festivity.wordDefinition:
Festivity and party both convey a sense of celebration or enjoyment, but festivity typically refers to a more formal or traditional celebration, while party is a more casual or informal gathering.

Festivities may involve specific rituals or customs, such as religious or cultural festivals, while parties are usually more open-ended and focused on socializing and having fun.

Festivities may also be associated with a specific time or place, such as a holiday or annual event, while parties can happen anytime and anywhere.

Overall, both words can describe enjoyable gatherings, but festivity is more formal and structured, while party is more casual and spontaneous.

Gather.wordDefinition:
Gather means to come together or assemble, usually for a specific purpose or reason.

It can be used in a variety of settings, such as a gathering of friends or family for a meal or a gathering of employees for a meeting.

It is usually more informal and celebratory than a 'gathering'.

A gather is a general term for people coming together, whereas a party is a specific kind of gathering that usually involves food, drinks, and celebrations.

Reception.wordDefinition:
A reception is a more formal gathering that usually follows a ceremony, like a wedding or a graduation. It is a way for the hosts to welcome and thank their guests for attending the ceremony.

The reception usually includes a sit-down meal and formalities like speeches, toasts, and first dances.

A party is more casual and can be held for various occasions, while a reception is a formal gathering that usually follows a ceremony.

quotes.Text: I think I take my job seriously, but I enjoy my life and I enjoy my friends, and I never really allowed myself to do that before. So I just kind of want to party with everyone.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Selena Gomez

quotes.Text: Madness is rare in individuals - but in groups, parties, nations, and ages it is the rule.
quotes.Title: German Philosopher
quotes.Name: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.Text: I get half a million just to show up at parties. My life is, like, really, really fun.
quotes.Title: American Celebrity
quotes.Name: Paris Hilton

quotes.Text: Eurovision' is a party. I've never said no to a party, so I'm not saying no to this.
quotes.Title: Danish Actor
quotes.Name: Pilou Asbaek

quotes.Text: I cook. Well, if I'm giving a dinner party I get in help.
quotes.Name: Princess Michael of Kent

quotes.Text: In my life, there's been a lot of partying.
quotes.Title: German Athlete
quotes.Name: Kevin-Prince Boateng

quotes.Text: I think that party music will live forever.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Redfoo

quotes.Text: My family is more important than my party.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: Zell Miller

quotes.Text: I rarely go to film parties.
quotes.Name: Neelam Kothari
